q: Four Dispatches investigation( presented by that notable Labour stooge, Peter Oborne ), a former senior NoW journalist revealed that Andy Coulson had personally listened to intercepted voicemail messages. He told the programme: Sometimes, they would say: "We've got a recording' and Andy Coulson would say:` OK, bring it into my office and play it to me' or` Bring me, email me a transcript of it.' In any case, as I have repeatedly pointed out, if Andy Coulson did know he's too wicked to stay in his post, and if he didn't know then he"s too stupid. Cameron is

LOS ANGELES( AP)-- Simon Cowell wants his American version of "The X Factor" to include controversy, vocal groups, not just soloists, and maybe, Paula Abdul as a judge. Simon Cowell says he's spoken to her, she knows I'm a big fan. He adds he's "always said at some point we are going to be working together." But, he says he has "to take everyone's opinions into account" including the show's other producers

pads designed by Unequal. "The Unequal technology is a part of my game now and I won't play without my Unequal," Michael Vick said in a statement, according to the Associated Press. Unequal's protective power gives me a whole new level of confidence in my game. It makes me feel invincible. Before serving 18 months in federal prison on charges related to his role in a dog fighting ring, Michael Vick was the National Football League's highest-paid player and one of the most desired endorsers in sports.

Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking.
